185939335.review:
Игра прикольная, она хардкорная и та атмосфера хоррор, вдобавок мультиплеер. Что может не пойти так?
Если бы она выпустилась раньше лефт 2, то есть где-то в 2004, стала бы хитом. А так, что имеем. 
ПЛЮСЫ: 
- Разнообразие оружие
- Один укус, считай что сдох, но если повезет, выживешь, чисто как в "ходячий мертвец"
- Хорошая атмосфера, передается тот самый ужас, непонимание куда и что.
- Расслабишься на один момент и получишь укус сзади от бегущего зомби или ребенок-квадрабобер
- В самом начале, ты никто. У тебя ничего нету и тебе придется искать: оружие, медик, огнестрельные пушки и патроны и неважные предметы для квеста.
МИНУСЫ:
- мультиплеер или просто сервер, слишком мало люди играют. Так что тут придётся позвать друзей, без никак
- квест неплохие, но они довольные примитивные, тебе туда бежать от А до Б, завершить несколько задание, чтобы прийти к финалу. И это один тип задание. Конечно, есть режим "Выживание", где идет волна зомби, но это всё, что есть.
- графика тоже примитивная, но хорошо передает атмосфере
- есть только три типы зомби: обычный зомби, медленно ходит как король в шахматы, есть бегущий и ребенок, тоже умеет бегать. Это всё, слишком мало тип зомби

НО поскольку она бесплатная, то можно забить на минусы и поиграть. Отлично подойдёт для вечер с пивом. 
Хотя жаль, что его не обновляли, в плане например сделать зону как Duzt. Вот это было бы прикольно, потому что так он будет похож на прожект зомбоид, где ты бы собрал еду, защиту и так далее.

185931504.review:
Думаете это весёлый зомби-шутер в духе L4D? А вот хрен вам.
В этой игре вы встретите зомби, которые начав атаковать ударят в любом случае, в не зависимости от того, как далеко вы убежали. 

Думаете зомби будут вашей главной заботой? Как же вы ошибаетесь...
Главной заботой будет мысль: "Что, делать дальше?!". Никто не укажет на цель, не подскажет где искать дверь, которую нужно вскрыть газовой горелкой, которую нужно найти в комнате закрытой на код, который спрятан на одном из тысячи мониторов в кишашем зомби городе.

Ну и конечно же стоит упомянуть лут. Играете с другими людьми и видите какой-то лут? Забирайте его весь! Ничего не должно достаться другим! Нет места в инвентаре? Запихивайте лут во все возможные отверстия, главное не отдавайте его остальным, это одна из основных целей игры, уж поверьте мне.

Итог: 8 разлетевшихся голов из 10

185887238.review: best free zombie game of all time

185881323.review: No More Room in Hell attempts to emulate the cooperative zombie survival experience of titles like Left 4 Dead but falls short in execution. The game suffers from clunky melee combat and inconsistent hit detection, diminishing the immersion. While the atmosphere is commendably tense, the overall experience is marred by technical issues and a lack of polish. Despite being free-to-play, the game's shortcomings make it hard to recommend over more refined alternatives in the genre.

185642524.review: Em No More Room in Hell, você e seus amigos são jogados em um apocalipse zumbi, onde a única coisa que você pode contar é a sua coragem (e talvez o estoque limitado de balas). Se você adora tensão, ação cooperativa e um toque de caos, prepare-se para suar frio enquanto tenta sobreviver a este inferno de mortos ambulantes! Super Recomendo No More Room In Hell.

185592519.review:
No More Room in Hell is honestly one of the best zombie survival games out there, and the fact that it’s free makes it even more amazing. Built on the Source engine, the game has great physics and solid mechanics, it really nails the feeling of being surrounded by zombies. The teamwork aspect is huge, you're constantly relying on other players to survive, which makes each session feel different and exciting. The community is great, you’ll find a lot of players who are serious about teamwork and making the game enjoyable for everyone.

Considering it's free, there’s absolutely no reason not to give it a try. The game offers a ton of content, and it’s definitely worth the download if you're into zombie games or just want something that’s both challenging and fun to play with friends.

Rating: 9/10
Definitely recommend it, especially since it's free!

If you do like horde shooters (Left for Dead/CoD Zombies/Vermintide/PAYDAY) you'll like this.

185229481.review: No More Room in Hell is a free, intense co-op zombie survival game with a gritty, immersive atmosphere. The gameplay is all about teamwork, scavenging, and holding off zombie waves, making for tense and rewarding moments. The graphics are outdated, and there’s a bit of a learning curve, but if you're into challenging survival horror with friends, it's a great pick.

185227445.review: Could be a really cool game. Unfortunately, it's an un-moderated toxic shit pile. If you're a fan of getting told to kill yourself or having auto moderator messages calling you re****ed, it's a great community for that.

185193093.review:
всем здарова. пишу по поводу игры "No More Room in Hell". 
No More Room in Hell - это не просто игра, это незабываемая атмосфера игромана, где можно провести время с кайфом, так ещё и с друзьями. очень рекомендую эту игру.
во-первых, она хоть и стара, малотребовательна, но при этом в ней нет багов - и сразу видно, что разработчики старались, вкладывали свою душу, силы и старания, что за это им отдельный респект.
во-вторых, сама игра очень интересна не только убийствами зомби, но ещё и своей своеобразностью. и я ни капли не жалею, что начала играть в эту игру..))
в конечном итоге скажу то, что игра достойна лайка и успешного продвижения, так что всем её рекомендую, если хотите провести время в соло/с корешами.

184867159.review:
I don't have the most time in this game. I have played this game on and off for the last 12 years and I highly HIGHLY recommend this gem of a game. 

Is it clunky? Yes. Is it graphically ugly? Absolutely. Do zombies have wonky melee hitboxes? Yup. 

But the positives far outshine the negatives. This game is meant to be cold and slow. You are not a hero. You are not Joe Badass. You are a random survivor who needs to make it out by the skin of his teeth. If you do not like slow combat, super limited stamina, infection, scarce resources, no HUD, killing children... don't play this. You will not like it. However, if you like the more slow paced and methodical combat and resource management: You will love this game.

This game has no meta-progression at all. This makes picking up and putting down the game for long stretches really nice because you aren't missing out on the brand new skin or brand new weapon or whatever the hell an update adds. You leave, come back 3 months later, and the game is still NMRIH. 
The missions are varied; some maps might feel alot more hateful towards the player but it never feels impossible. The basic maps like Broadway are excellent learning maps with the perfect variation of hoards, objectives, and length for a newer player to pick up. The servers are active and the community for this game feels diverse (not the progressive way the skill levels are varied making each map feel less like a meta fest and more just a group of survivors surviving). 

I highly recommend it: It's free, takes up very little space, and can run on any old PC. Give it a try : )

184857656.review:
[i] "Quando não houver mais espaço no inferno, os mortos caminharão sobre a Terra” [/i]

NMRIH é um bom game de zumbi no estilo clássico do George Romero, com foco no coop e sobrevivência tática. A dificuldade é bem alta, os recursos são escassos e você precisa pensar antes de agir. A comunidade é ativa, tem workshop, e o melhor: [b] é grátis [/b] e roda em PCs fracos. Se você curte zumbis com uma vibe mais lenta e estratégica, vale a pena tentar, se não, eu recomendo que você fique no L4D, KF ou B4B mesmo

184783390.review:
[h1] No More Room In Hell: 100% COMPLETION REVIEW [/h1]

[hr][/hr]
[code][b]If you love completing games, take a look at our [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/44890520/]curator site. [/url][/b][/code]

[hr][/hr]
When there's no more room in hell, the dead will walk the earth.

Realistic. Depressing. Bleak. Those are words that perfectly describe No More Room In Hell, a first person zombie game often compared to Left 4 Dead 2, despite the only similarity being the premise. While L4D2 is lighthearted, fast paced and comedic, NMRiH is very slow, methodical, and requires lots of patience. The appeal of No More Room In Hell is the feeling of having prevailed against all odds basically. Running on the Source engine along with its natural gritty look, this game is surely an experience.

This is not for the faint of heart, since merely surviving a single map and extracting alive will cost your sanity. Firstly, our character is not meant to be a hero, but rather an unathletic average person, so movement speed is very slow and stamina depletes after just a couple of melee weapon swings. Secondly, there's little to no HUD: to know how much ammo we have, we have to check the gun itself with an animation. Zombies also move slow and look actually braindead, as they should, apart from the occasional runner. There's also unique mechanics, like the brain stem, which is a small hitbox inside zombie heads that will instantly kill them with a gun shot in Nightmare difficulty.

Objectives are simple and clear, but don't describe what we have to do. We're on our own to find the necessary key, or blowtorch to open a locked gate, or bomb to explode, which is easier said than done, since killing ONE zombie will be a hassle, let alone pass through a horde. Getting a single hit will always have a chance to make the player bleed, and a single bite can infect the player. Gene therapy, a very rare syringe that can spawn somewhere can cure the player, but there's another unique method in this game: pointing a gun at ourselves and committing suicide, in order not to turn and run after our co-op partners. Go, my friend, go... I'm now one of them.

It's very unlikely for anyone to actually unlock every achievement for this game. Even the most straightforward ones have us survive every map in the game at least once, which is already a colossal feat. At least 5 other highly committed players are needed for the "We Got This!" achievement, and one needs to kill 1,619,090 zombies, in this very slow paced game where we can only kill 10 zombies per minute max. Workshop maps can technically make this doable however. The following guide can help, but it's strongly advised to play NMRiH purely for the gameplay and immersion due to the ridiculous amount of effort needed: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2436880448

184644150.review: Overall, if you're into realistic gameplay, this game is definitely worth checking out. The weapon handling and healing mechanics are pretty amazing. That said, NMRIH2 doesn’t quite live up to the original. Sure, the graphics are better, but No More Room in Hell 1 has better mods and more polished mechanics. Both games are great, but if you don’t want to spend $20 on the newer one, the first game is a solid alternative with tons of content since it’s been out longer. Until they fix some of the issues in NMRIH2, I’d say stick with the original for now.

184086414.review:
If you would have told me a super old free to play source mod turned full fledged game would be a sudden top of my list for "best zombie media I've ever seen" in recent memory, I would have called you crazy. If you would have told me it was also free, I would have said you were also insane.

My stint with No More Room in Hell was one I was not expecting to get very engrossed by. I was expecting to bounce off of it and play something else, what instead happened was that it gobbled up a bunch of hours from me really quick and easily. 

It plays like a Left 4 Dead game, get to the end of the mission, zombie spawns are infinite and drain resources, get to the end by any means necessary 

Except its much slower than Left 4 Dead, so much so that even a single zombie at a bad moment can kill you. There are decent ways to kill them quickly, whether through guns or certain melee weapons, but ammo is a rarity that should only be spent when needed, and melee weapons that kill zombies quick are usually big and take a lot of inventory space so you can't take a gun and lots of ammo for emergencies. Often times you might get in a situation where you are tossing away guns for medical supplies because at least you can guarantee getting to use them, unlike finding the specific ammo caliber for your specific weapon. 

Supplies in general are pretty uncommon, its punishing in a lot of ways if you take hits. And the most crazy part to it is that the game has an infection mechanic. If you get bit (which is a specific attack they do thats telegraphed), there is a percentage chance you are infected and have to either use pills you find around the map to stave it off until you extract, or something called gene therapy that essentially cures you, but it doesn't turn fully turned zombies back into normal people so its not a full cure.
 
But there is another option. If you have a loaded gun, and no other options for survival, you can kill yourself with it. But why would you do such a thing? Because freshly zombie-fied individuals turn into runner zombies that attack faster and do more damage. And also can infect people. And on that note, if someone is infected, you are able to TK them. 

Its a methodical game where your movement and positioning matters quite a lot on top of your melee capabilities. There might be 8 player teams this time around, but in a setting where a single mistake can potentially get you infected/killed, you tend to want to avoid combat unless you are really good or can't kite.

Compared to other games where you fly through single zombies easy breezy, a game that makes every single one potentially deadly is surprisingly fun. With a good team, you can fly through missions pretty will. But if you aren't, you're gonna be spending a lot of time just making sure you don't get infected and stay together as best you can. Getting separated is a quick way to end up lost and away from your team, despite it being like Left 4 Dead, its much easier to get lost in these levels. 

Zombies respawn infinitely means you have to get to the end with what you are given and press forward unless you want to be overwhelmed. Sometimes the game will throw runner zombies at you as a wave, sometimes you'll end up having to fight zombified children which can't infect you but are harder to hit and can be annoying to deal with because their fast attacks mean they can do some of the highest chip damage in a game if you are not careful. But, they are incredibly easy to kill in turn. 

The only bad thing about it is the horrid voice lines from some of the characters that can break the otherwise bleak and unforgiving tone of the game. 

Its a game I will go back to eventually, when I feel in the mood for it. As much as I like this, and can recommend it, I have stuff like EDF to play which is not like this at all lol
